technology.name: The Innovators
technology.description: Walter Isaacson's in-depth look at the people who created the computer and the internet, from Ada Lovelace to the digital revolutionaries of today.

technology.name: Steve Jobs
technology.description: Walter Isaacson's biography of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, offering insight into his life, work, and impact on the world of technology and innovation.

technology.name: The Code Book
technology.description: Simon Singh's exploration of the history of cryptography, from ancient ciphers to modern-day encryption and its impact on security in the digital age.

technology.name: The Second Machine Age
technology.description: Erik Brynjolfsson and Andrew McAfee’s look at how digital technologies like AI, robotics, and automation are changing economies and society.

technology.name: How We Got to Now
technology.description: Steven Johnson's exploration of six innovations that shaped the modern world, from glass to refrigeration, and their unforeseen consequences.

technology.name: The Lean Startup
technology.description: Eric Ries' guide to building startups using lean principles, focusing on how companies can innovate quickly, test ideas, and efficiently grow their business.

technology.name: Zero to One
technology.description: Peter Thiel's book on how to create a successful startup, encouraging entrepreneurs to think big and create something entirely new rather than copying existing models.

technology.name: The Everything Store
technology.description: Brad Stone's biography of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, detailing the rise of the online retailer and its profound effect on e-commerce, technology, and society.

technology.name: The Shallows
technology.description: Nicholas Carr's exploration of how the internet and digital technologies are affecting our brains, and how our relationship with technology is changing the way we think.

technology.name: AI Superpowers
technology.description: Kai-Fu Lee’s exploration of the rise of artificial intelligence in China and the U.S., and its implications for the global economy and future job market.

technology.name: The Singularity Is Near
technology.description: Ray Kurzweil’s look at the future of technology, arguing that the merging of humans and machines will lead to an era of unprecedented change and advancement.

technology.name: Blockchain Basics
technology.description: Daniel Drescher’s beginner's guide to understanding blockchain technology, how it works, and its potential impact on industries like finance, healthcare, and more.

technology.name: Wired for War
technology.description: P.W. Singer’s exploration of robotics, AI, and drones in modern warfare, and how technology is reshaping the future of combat and the military.

technology.name: The Phoenix Project
technology.description: Gene Kim, Kevin Behr, and George Spafford’s novel that uses a fictional narrative to explain DevOps principles and the importance of collaboration in IT systems.

technology.name: Artificial Intelligence: A Guide for Thinking Humans
technology.description: Melanie Mitchell’s accessible overview of artificial intelligence, covering its current capabilities, challenges, and what it means for the future of humanity.

technology.name: Hacking Growth
technology.description: Sean Ellis and Morgan Brown’s guide to the strategies and tactics used by some of the world’s fastest-growing companies to use data and experimentation to drive growth.

technology.name: Tech Titans of China
technology.description: Rebecca Fannin's exploration of the Chinese tech industry, including companies like Alibaba, Tencent, and Baidu, and how they are shaping the future of technology globally.

technology.name: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
technology.description: Martin Kleppmann’s technical guide to designing and building modern data systems, focusing on scalability, reliability, and maintainability in the face of large-scale data.

technology.name: Cloudonomics
technology.description: Joe Weinman’s exploration of the economic benefits and challenges of cloud computing, and how businesses can leverage cloud-based solutions to optimize operations.

technology.name: Rework
technology.description: Jason Fried and David Heinemeier Hansson’s revolutionary book on how to build a successful business in the modern world, with a focus on simplicity and flexibility.
